result.execSummary:
The defendant David S. Althoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David S. Althoff

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Order for Assessment and Driver's Safety Plan sent to Attorney Lucarelli as it was not signed in court with request to return signed original to Clerk.

3:33 p.m. Defendant David S. Althoff in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Defendant David S. Althoff in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf50, 15cf188, 15cf271, 15tr519. State moves to dimiss but read-in 15cf188 - Granted. Parties stipulate that refusal was reasonable.  State moves to amend Counts 1 and 2 in 15cf271  to misdemeanor bail jumping - violation of 945.49(1)(a) - Granted. State moves to dismiss 15tr519 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest pleas.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bednar/Lucareli/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
15cf50
WHS/POP - 3 years
Fine - $2655/Blood Draw Surcharge/IID Surcharge
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Jail - 170 days with Huber for all purposes. May serve in Oneida or Vilas or any county of employment.
Driver's License revocation - 30 months
IID - 30 months
Jail credit - 1 day
Driver's Safety plan
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
AODA assessment
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

15cf271
WHS/POP - 2 years concurrent
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Jail credit - 82 days

Appeal rights and payment plan application given
Adj. 3:51 p.m.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David S. Althoff in court with attorney Steven Michael Lucareli.  Defendant David S. Althoff in custody from Vilas County.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3pm - 
Calling 15cf271 (AIA) ,15cf188,15cf50 and 15tr519(refusal) 
Bednar statement regarding stipulation to charges in 15cf50,also  stipulation to venue and ID -no stipulation to 4rd offense in 5 years -   - Court at this time - will not find that a felony has been committed -amends to 4th as a misdemeanor - 
in regards 15cf188  - Defendant waives preliminary hearing -   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. 
In receipt of complaint in 15cf271 - waives reading - waive preliminary hearing -   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.
Lucarelli would like to proceed with plea on  15cf50  - Side bar - Agreement reached on all matters - request date for plea and sentencing - parties stipulate to defendant receiving up front credit on 15cf271 as he is on a cash bond on that matter - and we are not prepared to go forward today 
Bail continued on all cases -  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Parties have stipulated to remove PH on 9/18 and will contact the JA to reschedule on 09/22/15.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

03:08 pm - Attorney Steven Michael Lucareli in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15tr519 and 15cf50.  Lucarelli appears telephonically with leave of the court.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 11:30 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

Defendant David S. Althoff in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:44
Defendant has not yet obtained counsel - has spoken to counsel - would like additional time to hire own - Court will grant adj - 
Bail continued  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Plus $4,000.00 signature bond.  No intoxicants, no taverns

01:27 pm - Defendant David S. Althoff in court, via video, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will obtain counsel,  Bednar statement to bail - Defendant states lives on Squash Lake.  Works at Walmart in Rhinelander.  Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
